column5: I was wondering if anyone knows anything about these the first one seems to be some kind of self winding reel..made in Japan  the second seems to be a saltwater reel, it doesn't have a thinging that goes back and forth to keep the line even but has a plastic knob on the handle, so can't be too old

Second one just looks like a Penn open reel. No "level wind". Many mfg's make this style of reel.  First one...I think it's a hand lining reel. Use them for hand lining Pickeral when drifting the river.
thanks the first one has the thingys to put it on a rod...like the high tech terms the second one has TacaBon NO.150 on it

55610. KALAMZOO TACKLE CO 1697 AUTO FLY REEL. Black Anodized Model 1697 C Miracle Silent Automatic horizontal Trout sized Auto Fly Reel. Routine Edge wear from fishing use. Working fine. G. 25.00.  http://images.google.ca/imgres?imgurl=http...%3D324%26um%3D1  55609. SHAKESPEARE SILENT TRU-ART #1837 AUTO FLY REEL. Green Anodized Model 1837 GE horizontal Trout sized Auto Fly Reel. Routine Edge wear from fishing use. Working fine. G. 25.00.  http://cgi.ebay.com/Vintage-USA-South-Bend...7QQcmdZViewItem
Yeah, the first one is a fly reel and the second is trolling type reel.
thanks, so I guess I need to take up fly fishing  the trolling one will work good for a  muskie for lures in the prop wash a real loud clicker on it

The first one is an automatic fly reel. Oldtimers may remember the Canadian AL&W tackle company. Seems that reel was made offshore and imported by them, seeing it is stamped made in Japan.  Some may find this link interesting:  http://ontariolures.com/lurecompanies/allcocklaight.html
Backtracked a bit on the previous link I posted, tons of pics of old Canadian/Ontario lures here, a few remember from my dad's tackle box  http://www.picturetrail.com/muskokasun
